post: [My students] still have their Pocket Constitutions as seniors.   Jeffrey M., California educator Your gift lasts long after the lesson ends. $1 = 1 copy ➡️  https://bit.ly/40EsBAg  #CivicsChampion  #CivicEducation  #TeacherVoices  #SupportTeachers  #Impact

Teachers, the first Civic Star Challenge deadline is almost here! Join hundreds of educators nationwide whove already entered to celebrate civic learning in their classrooms. No new lesson plan required: just log what youre already teaching and you could earn up to $10,000 in awards. ⏰ Enter by midnight of October 31:  https://bit.ly/3V1CQuX  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #Teachers  #CivicEngagement

What counts as civic impact? More than you think. MyImpact Challenge projects range from book drives to business ideas, art programs, and recycling clubs. If it strengthens your community, it counts. 💡 See how to get your students started:  https://bit.ly/3fyGGr3  #MyImpactChallenge  #CommunityImpact  #StudentVoice  #CivicEducation

How did Westward Expansion shape Americas identity, and at what cost? In this new Civics & U. S. History for Middle School video, students explore Alfred Wauds The Last Mile of the Pacific Railroad  (1869) to uncover the promise and price of progress. 🎥 Watch:  https://bit.ly/4ohWb8k  #CivicEducation  #AmericanHistory  #TeachingResources  #SocialStudies

Applause for National Civics Teacher of the Year finalist Joe Harmon (Redbank Valley HS, PA)! A former paramedic turned educator, he scaffolds civics, pairing content with dispositions, civil dialogue, and real-world practice (letters, debates, amendable  class rules). Read Joes spotlight:  https://bit.ly/47HwDeR  #CivicEducation  #CivicDiscourse  #CivicLeadership

☮️  #OTD in 1962, the U. S. and USSR reached an agreement ending the Cuban Missile Crisis, averting nuclear war. How can this moment teach students about diplomacy, leadership, and the risks of brinkmanship? 🔗 Lesson:  https://bit.ly/4qsOKg7  #TDiH  #CubanMissileCrisis  #ColdWar  #CivicEducation  #Leadership

📜  #OTD in 1787, Federalist No. 1 was published, the first of 85 essays by Hamilton, Madison, and Jay defending the Constitution. How can these essays help students see the importance of debate in shaping a free society? 🔗 Lesson:  https://bit.ly/42WkFvd  #TDiH  #FederalistPapers  #CivicEducation  #AmericanHistory  #SelfGovernment

Close October strong. Log 1 activity by Friday to get your class in the Civic Star Challenges first round. It takes minutes, and youll keep building entries all year. 🔗  https://bit.ly/3V1CQuX  #CivicStarChallenge  #CivicEducation  #TeachingResources  #America250

These Constitutions go very fast! Feedback from principals, teachers, and parents has been extremely positive as they encourage kids to learn and truly understand the scope & spirit of our founding documents. What made the Monroe Doctrine a cornerstone of early U. S. foreign policy? This Primary Source Essentials episode unpacks Monroes 1823 address, warning Europe against colonization while shaping Americas role in the Western Hemisphere. 🎥 Watch now:  https://bit.ly/4oEBd3r  #PrimarySources  #CivicEducation  #AmericanHistory  #ForeignPolicy
